definition: to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
surname Shu
to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
to distance oneself from (classical)

sentences.english: She has made so many passes at me recently that I think it necessary to freeze her off.
sentences.chinese: 最近她多次向我拋送秋波，我覺得有必要疏遠她。

sentences.english: We need to have a happy medium between being too close and too distant to our friends.
sentences.chinese: 對待朋友應在過分親近與過分疏遠中，選擇中庸之道。

sentences.english: Aeriform lieutenant general does group of relations intimately to be done aloof and tensely originally.
sentences.chinese: 無形中將原本親密的幹羣關係弄得疏遠而緊張了。

sentences.english: Maybe she doesn’t even know why I suddenly kept away from her.
sentences.chinese: 也許到現在她都不知道我爲什麼突然間地疏遠了她。

sentences.english: And that shows to some degree I think, their own sense of alienation from their own society.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我覺得他們，顯然疏遠了他們的社會。

sentences.english: It was goiter in fact. Because of it, people kept away from her.
sentences.chinese: 但實際上是個腫物，人們因此而疏遠她。

sentences.english: The relationship between Russia and Yakoob Regime was relatively stand-offish in later period.
sentences.chinese: 俄國與後期阿古柏政權的關係較爲冷卻疏遠。

sentences.english: Brokerage firm, said Hyun Bin and Song Hye Kyo very busy their work, relationships become more distant nature.
sentences.chinese: 工作都非常繁忙，關係自然變得比較疏遠。

sentences.english: After that, she began to distance herself from me.
sentences.chinese: 自那以後，她開始疏遠我。

sentences.english: Madeleine was not trying to estrange her from the Herzogs.
sentences.chinese: 馬德琳無意要使她和赫索格家的人疏遠。

sentences.english: Make career changes that may increase your income. Difficulties with female members of your family may result in estrangements.
sentences.chinese: 與女性家庭成員的矛盾會讓你們變得疏遠。

sentences.english: But for some reason Mr. Brick had been estranged from all his relatives for decades.
sentences.chinese: 但爲了某些原因，布瑞克先生和親人疏遠了幾十年。

sentences.english: It is the chief cause of a Promethean 's estrangement from mortals.
sentences.chinese: 這是造成活屍與人類疏遠的主要原因。

sentences.english: His behavior alienated him and his brother.
sentences.chinese: 他的行爲使他跟哥哥疏遠了。

sentences.english: The mountains return, ChenFeng found DongXiaoHan began to distance herself from yourself.
sentences.chinese: 山中歸來，陳峯發現董曉晗開始疏遠自己。

sentences.english: The two became estranged over the years, and there were reports of infidelities from both parties.
sentences.chinese: 兩人多年來變得疏遠，雙方都有外遇的傳聞。

definition: to become alienated/estranged/alienation/disaffection/set wide apart
intimate/to get close to
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
variant of 關係|关系[guan1 xi5]
to be in a tangle/to nag
to quarrel/dispute
sometimes/now and then
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to blame/to rebuke
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
to get angry
